title: CPR (Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation)
steps: Check for responsiveness and breathing.
Call for emergency help if unresponsive.
Place hands in the center of the chest.
Push hard and fast at a rate of 100-120 compressions per minute.
Give 2 rescue breaths after every 30 compressions if trained.
Continue until help arrives or the person breathes.

title: Bleeding Control
steps: Put on gloves if available.
Apply direct pressure to the wound with a clean cloth.
Elevate the injured area if possible.
Keep pressure on until bleeding stops.
Apply a bandage securely once bleeding stops.

title: Burn Care
steps: Cool the burn with running water for 10 minutes.
Remove tight clothing or jewelry near the area.
Cover the burn loosely with a sterile, non-stick dressing.
Do not apply ice or creams.
Seek medical help for severe burns.

title: Choking Adult
steps: Ask if the person can speak or cough.
If not, stand behind and give 5 back blows between shoulder blades.
Follow with 5 abdominal thrusts (Heimlich maneuver).
Repeat until the object is expelled or help arrives.

title: Fracture (Broken Bone)
steps: Immobilize the injured area.
Apply a splint if you know how.
Use ice to reduce swelling (not directly on skin).
Seek medical attention as soon as possible.
